ygData.subject: Re: Twinking??
ygData.msgSnippet: Gift giving amongst guildmates is NOT twinking, unless a level one ends up with a screaming mace and complete banded...hehe....I just got to the point where I
ygData.messageBody:
Gift giving amongst guildmates is NOT twinking, unless a level one ends up
with a screaming mace and complete banded...hehe....I just got to the point
where I could "pay back" my brothers for gifting me with some of my armor
and my bow. I figured Dvinn's dagger for our resident rogue was a cool
return. =) And it really made me feel good to share the wealth, as it
were. Our rogue was thrilled, and I felt like I was finally contributing.
I agree--that's not twinking; that's part of why we join guilds.
Sara, Povar

Heather Hire wrote:

> From: Heather Hire <hrootbeer@...>
>
> Most of the twinking I've seen done is male characters switching from
> one to another. I have seen female characters begging for things
> either free or for less than the going price...saw this yesterday and
> was VERY verbal to the young lady as she was not only a half-elf, but
> also a bard...Needless to say that Genneth got quite righteous! (but
> totally in character) As for myself, most of the things that I have
> been given came from guildmembers either passing along outdated items
> (which I have also done for newer guild members)or just being nice
> because a bard is always poor (I have a Qeynos guard shield that was
> such a gift).
>
> I don't consider this gift giving twinking. And if someone in my guild
> gave me a full set of armor, I would take it and when I earned enough
> to replace it with better, I would pass the gift along...I never sell
> gifts...
>
> Genneth
